title: Final: Patriots 28, Buccaneers 23: 7 straight wins for Pats
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots defeated the Tampa Bay Buccaneers 28-23, securing their seventh consecutive win.
TreVeyon Henderson's 69-yard touchdown run sealed the game for the Patriots against Tampa Bay.
Stefon Diggs scored a key touchdown with a last-second catch in the second quarter for New England.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, is charged with drunk driving after crashing his car into a pole.
Daveiga allegedly drove onto the sidewalk at Leverett Circle and failed sobriety tests administered by Massachusetts State Police.
Officer Daveiga has pleaded not guilty, placed on modified duty, and is due back in Charlestown court on December 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees of Allston Car Wash detained by ICE agents remain in federal custody as of November 9, 2025.
The detainees, all with work permits, were not allowed to retrieve their documents during the November 4 raid.
Information about the detainees' status is limited, and one worker was reportedly moved to Texas despite a court order.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the November 8, 2025 episode of 'Saturday Night Live', with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser rose to fame in 2024 after a standout performance at the Tom Brady roast.
The episode featured Glaser's monologue, Pete Davidson's return on 'Weekend Update', and performances by Sombr.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a game-sealing goal for the Bruins in a 5-3 win over the Maple Leafs.
Minten was traded to Boston from Toronto last season, marking his first return to Toronto since the trade.
The Bruins' victory in Toronto extended their winning streak to six games during the 2025 NHL season.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto, receiving his ring and plaque on Saturday.
Chara, a Bruins legend and Stanley Cup champion, reflected on his career alongside fellow inductee Joe Thornton.
Chara's achievements include a Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star appearances, and winning the Norris and Messier awards.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox predicted to target top free agents like Alex Bregman and Kyle Schwarber this offseason.
Boston has approximately $25 million before first luxury tax threshold, allowing room for significant signings.
Analysts also see potential fits for Pete Alonso, Munetaka Murakami, Dylan Cease, and Framber Valdez with Red Sox.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, celebrating 20 years since his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
Legend's show mixed tracks from his debut album with songs from his career, displaying musical versatility and showmanship.
The concert included covers and highlights from Legend's pre-stardom days, showcasing influences from artists like Lauryn Hill and Kanye West.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, similar to Monday's loss to the Jazz.
Brown refrained from detailed comments about officiating, implying restraint in response to questions about his scoring difficulties.
Despite Brown's remarks, the NBA confirmed a missed foul call in the previous Jazz game but he wasn't fined for his comments.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face Buccaneers in Week 10, each leading their respective divisions; Buccaneers have a 6-2 record.
Buccaneers' Baker Mayfield is an MVP contender with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and a strong deep passing game.
Bucs' top receivers Chris Godwin and Mike Evans are out; Sterling Shephard and Tez Johnson to replace them.
